Tap on screen to toggle video control buttons. \n\nTouch small preview window to move it.
Start Silent Phone on boot Start Silent Phone during the device\'s startup procedure.
Enable firewall traversal If Silent Phone detects a restrictive firewall, try extra hard to complete your call.
Force firewall traversal Use a more reliable but lower-quality method of connecting the call audio, which may be needed on particularly bad networks.
Dropout tone Play low tone if no media packets are arriving. If heard often, you or your partner may want to change networks.
Echo canceler Automatic control of echo canceler. If not selected the echo canceler is always active
Show all errors Minor software errors that don\'t affect your experience are hidden by default.
Enable developer menus If you aren\'t a developer, don\'t check this!
SSL debug level Set the SSL debug level. 0 means debugging off, 4 means full verbose debugging.
Axolotl debug level Set the Axolotl debug level. 0 means debugging off, 6 means epic.
Dial assist To simplify dialing, turn on Dial Assist and select a country. The number will automatically be formatted with your country code. Otherwise, dial \'+\' and the country code. To call other Silent Circle subscribers, simply dial their Silent Circle subscriber name. Select your country No dial assist Simple dial assist
Dial assist disabled. Adds \'+\' to form an international phone number. Adds \'+\' or \'+1\' or replaces a leading \'011\' with a \'+\' sign. Replaces a leading \'%1$s\' with country code %2$s and a leading \'%3$s\' with the \'+\' sign. Adds \'%2$s\' to dialed digits and replaces a leading \'%3$s\' with the \'+\' sign.

No error Unknown error code Generic error code, unspecified error Unsupported protocol version Buffer too small to store some data Could not decrypt a received message Found no own identity for registration Missing a required JSON field No registered messaging devices found for the user Offered pre-key not found - unknown pre-key id No session for this user found Session not initialized Message too old to decrypt Incoming data corrupt Axolotl conversation exists while trying to setup new one HMAC check of encrypted message failed Incorrect padding of decrypted message Incorrect padding of decrypted supplementary data Not a real error, just to report that no staged keys available Mismatch of receiver\'s long term identity Mismatch of sender\'s long term identity Expected length of data does not match received length Expected device id does not match actual device id Network error or server request failed

Their identity key and our identity key use different curve types

Basic account
With a basic account, you get unlimited secure messaging and free incoming calls. \n\nVisit the Silent Circle website and upgrade your account to make outgoing calls.
With a basic account, you are limited in usage of features. \n\nVisit the Silent Circle website and upgrade your account.
Your account has expired. Visit the Silent Circle website and renew your account to make outgoing secure calls. \n\nIn the meantime, you can still receive secure calls and send/receive secure messages.
You have run out of minutes. Visit the Silent Circle website and add credit to your account to make outgoing secure calls. \n\nIn the meantime, you can still receive secure calls and send/receive secure messages.
You have run out of credit. Visit the Silent Circle website and add credit to your account to make outgoing secure calls. \n\nIn the meantime, you can still receive secure calls and send/receive secure messages.
You are running low on minutes. Visit the Silent Circle website and add credit to your account to make outgoing secure calls. \n\nIn the meantime, you can still receive secure calls and send/receive secure messages.
You are running low on credit. Visit the Silent Circle website and add credit to your account to make outgoing secure calls. \n\nIn the meantime, you can still receive secure calls and send/receive secure messages.
Funding required To use Silent Circle\'s services, you must fund your account with a minimum of $5.00 USD. \n\nClick below to begin. Fund account

Please acknowledge the request in the next dialog to keep SilentPhone connected. If SilentPhone is not connect then you cannot receive calls or text messages. SilentPhone has an advanced power management if in standby mode and the impacts on battery lifetime are negligible.

%s%%
Why access to Phone? Silent Phone does not initiate phone calls that require the device\'s phone application. \n\nHowever, Silent Phone monitors if you have an active call or if you receive a call while you are using Silent Phone. In these cases Silent Phone either manages the Silent Phone call or informs you about the incoming call using a notification tone.
Required Silent Phone Permissions <b>Audio</b>: to setup calls or to record audio attachments (if enabled). <br/><br/><b>Camera:</b> enables video calls and video attachments. <br/><br/><b>Contacts:</b> get data to setup a call or a messaging session. Silent Phone does not send contact data to Silent Circle or others.
Silent Phone permissions missing Silent Phone cannot work without the required permissions, exiting. You may start Silent Phone again and grant the required permissions.
Why access to Location? Silent Phone access the location send attach location information to a message if you enabled this feature.
Why access to Storage? On user request Silent Phone can store or share attachments. This requires permission to access external storage.
